p: Thespasmolytic effect (0.3–3.0 mg/mL) of the D. aegyptium’s ethanol extract was also hypothesized to be due to Ca 2+ blocking components which ultimately causes relaxation of gastrointestinal smooth muscle, combating diarrhea [ 178]. Similarly to C. ciliaris, this species is also used traditionally to cope with these gastrointestinal disorders [ 178]. Once again, its chemical composition is still unknown.
